title: Forces - Sum of forces in radial direction

content.question: Which of the following statements about the normal force <math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></math> of the track exerted on the cart at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math> is correct and provides correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub N equals m g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>, because the normal force and the weight of the cart are a Newton’s third law pair.

<math alttext="F sub N equals m g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>, because the cart is accelerating upwards at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>.

<math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="m g" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></math> at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, because the normal force and the weight of the cart are not a Newton’s third law pair.
